Cache

Type: Interface

Description

Cache<K, V> is a generic interface representing the basic operations for a key-value based caching system. It abstracts common cache functionality such as retrieval, insertion, deletion, and containment checks.

Use Cases

  • Blueprint for implementing caching mechanisms like LRU, LFU, or FIFO
  • Interface for pluggable cache strategies in frameworks or applications
  • Reduces recomputation by storing previously calculated results

Method Summary

Return Type Method Description
V get(K key) Retrieves the value for the given key, or null if not present
void put(K key, V value) Inserts or updates the value associated with the key
boolean contains(K key) Checks whether the key exists in the cache
void remove(K key) Removes the entry associated with the key
int size() Returns the total number of entries
void clear() Clears all key-value pairs from the cache

Sample Usage


// Example using a concrete implementation like LRUCache
Cache<Integer, String> cache = new LRUCache<>(3);
cache.put(1, "One");
cache.put(2, "Two");

System.out.println(cache.get(1)); // Output: "One"
System.out.println(cache.contains(2)); // Output: true

cache.remove(2);
System.out.println(cache.size()); // Output: 1

cache.clear();

Available Implementations

  • AbstractCache - Abstract base class for cache implementation
